title: Bug 45145: Second window comes to front when using first
description: When using two Eclipse windows and switching between them and clicking on a docked view or perspective, the second window unexpectedly comes to the front over other applications' windows.
OB: When I switch from another application to one Eclipse window and click on a docked view or perspective, the other Eclipse window comes to the front and covers my other applications' windows.
EB: Unless I click on the Eclipse dock icon, the only time a window should come to the front is if I click on it explicitly or if some specific behavior within Eclipse takes me to a widget in the other window.
SR:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open two Eclipse windows.
2. Switch from another application to one of the Eclipse windows.
3. Click on a docked view or perspective in the active Eclipse window.
4. Observe that the other Eclipse window comes to the front over other applications' windows unexpectedly.
